activation_hypothesis: HDAC inhibition leads to hyperacetylation of histone H3 at the promoter, increasing accessibility for STAT3.
Butyrate increases SP1 binding to the promoter, upregulating mucin production.
Acetate acts as a direct ligand for FFAR2 (GPR43), triggering a signaling cascade that stabilizes the promoter complex.
SCFA-induced HDAC inhibition increases BDNF expression via the CREB pathway in the gut-brain axis.
High concentrations of specific SCFAs in dysbiotic states can paradoxically trigger NF-kB binding at the TNF promoter.
Hydrogen sulfide inhibits cytochrome c oxidase, leading to oxidative stress and NF-kB activation of PTGS2.
Succinate accumulates in the gut and activates GPR91, leading to HIF-1a stabilization and promoter binding.
Secondary bile acids act as direct ligands for the Farnesoid X Receptor (FXR) encoded by this gene.
OspF enters the nucleus to irreversibly dephosphorylate MAPK, preventing recruitment of RNA polymerase II.
Induces DNA double-strand breaks, triggering the p53 pathway and upregulating p21 to arrest the cell cycle.
macro_level_effect: Cell cycle arrest / DNA damage response
